result.execSummary:
The defendant Dakota Scott Lindquist was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dakota Scott Lindquist is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dakota Scott Lindquist was found guilty of 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Dakota Scott Lindquist was found guilty of 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Dakota Scott Lindquist was found guilty of 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Counts to run Concurrent to each other.
Court dismisses Count 1 but if Defendant is revoked the State will refile Count 1.
Defendant to sign up for Probation within the next 24 hours of today April 18, 2017.
Probation may be transferred to St. Louis County Minnesota.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be held open for 3 years for expenses for the Victims Counseling.

Continue on current payment plan with the Clerk's Office.
DNA surcharge.

From DE stating he lost service w/the last person he talked to, but it was brought to his attention that he has a WA & will be in tomrw morning to make pymt.  Ret'd call to DE & advised him that if he shows up without pymt in full, he will be brought to the Jail.  DE stated he was aware of this & inquired about what would take place in court.  DE was advised that it is entirely up to the Judge & I cannot predict the outcome of court for him.  DE was advised that he could make a $200 pymt for his late Jan pymt via GPNet & then his file would be sent to the Judge for review & his WA may get quashed without having to appear.  DE was encouraged to make a $400 pymt if possible as his Feb pymt is then due next wk.  DE stated he was having issues w/his Probation & that he also "thought" he made a pymt online but didn't have "the time" to see if the pymt went through.  DE was advised that he will be given a confirmation # when pymts are made via GPNet & unless he was given one, his pymt likely did not go through successfully.  DE was also reminded that he is the one who requested to make pymts of $200/mo although I tried to advise him that a lower pymt might be more sufficient based on his history of non pymt & WA fees & interest continue to be added each time he misses his pymt.  DE will turn himself in to the Jail or make pymt & was reminded again that pymts do not have to be pd in person.  Includes 15CF421, 17TR1587. jaf

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Daniel Frank Demaio, DF: Dakota Scott Lindquist appeared.  Court called.  There is an agreement.  Victim rights have been complied with.  State files an amended Information with the court.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct 2, Ct. 3 & Ct. 4 in the amended Information.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2, Ct 3 & Ct 4.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 1 without prejudice. Sentencing arguments.  Victim's parents make statements. Crt orders:


Ct. 2 Ct. 3 & Ct. 4 in the amended Information to run concurrent to each other
S/W 3 years probation with conditions
- Probation can be transferred to St. Louis County in Minnesota
-  DE to  have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the victims, S.H.S, S.A.H. & T.C.S. in 15CF421.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- DE to undergo a Psychological Examination & Mental Evaluation for Sexual Deviency 
- DE to undergo any recommended treatment by probation
- DE to sign up probation within the next 24 hours from todays date 04/18/17
- Restitution to remain open for 3 years for expenses for the victims for counseling
- Court costs of $729.00 and $600 for the DNA surcharge to be paid through probation
- If revoked State will refile on Ct. 1 in 15CF421
- 20 days to appeal

DE called at 11 am stating that he thought he made his pymt for this case.  DE was advised that we did receive a pymt for his Traffic fine, but not this case.  DE stated the site tells him that he does not owe a bal & will not allow him to make the pymt & has been having issues.  DE was advised that the wicourts.gov site will only allow pymts to be made on cases that have been closed out and/or assessed costs,etc & he will need to utilize the GPNet site for this case from now on because it is an open case.  DE to make his pymt online today by 4:30 pm or he will be issued a WA tomrw. jaf

*Amended* on 12/10/15 & 03/15/16

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, S.A.H, S.H.S., T.C.S., New Richmond High School, 1382 157th Ave, New Richmond, WI and  734 E 11th St. New Ricmond, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
